tasks.name: Involuntary Memory Task
tasks.definition: Participants performed an involuntary memory task while undergoing an fMRI scan. Environmental sounds served as cues for well-associated pictures of negative and neutral scenes. Participants were presented with sound-picture pairs and unpaired sounds, and they were asked to rate the emotionality of the stimuli and to judge the location of the sound. Post-scan, participants reported whether they remembered a picture when the sound was played, how hard they tried to perform the task correctly, how hard they tried to recall a picture, and how vivid the memory was.
conditions: Paired sounds that elicited a memory with low effort
Unpaired sounds that did not elicit a memory with low effort
